00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Contains the view-Class that is used to render view-templates (layout,views,elements)

00016 /**
00017  * default view class. used to render the view (and layout) for the controller
00018  * @package kata
00019  */
00020 class View {
00021              /**
00022               * controller class that the dispatcher called
00023               * @var object
00024               */
00025              protected $controller;
00026 
00027              /**
00028               * array which holds all relevant information for the current view:
00029               * [isAjax] => false (boolean, tells you if view got called with /ajax/)
00030               * [url] => Array (
00031               *       [url] => locations
00032               *       [foo] => bar (if url read ?foo=bar)
00033               * )
00034               * [form] => Array (
00035               *             (all post-variables, automatically dequoted if needed)
00036               * )
00037               * [controller] => main (name of the controller of this request)
00038               * [action] => index (name of the view of this request)
00039               * @var array
00040               */
00041              public $params;
00042 
00043              /**
00044               * name of the action of the current controller the dispatcher called
00045               * @var string
00046               */
00047              public $action;
00048 
00049              /**
00050               * absolute filesystem path to the webroot folder
00051               * @var string
00052               */
00053              public $webroot;
00054 
00055              /**
00056               * base url of this framework
00057               * @var string
00058               */
00059              public $base;
00060 
00061              /**
00062               * array of helpers you can access inside the view via $this->helpername
00063               * @var array
00064               */
00065              public $helpers=array("Html");
00066 
00067              /**
00068               * array of all variables we got passed from the controller via set() or setRef()
00069               * @var array
00070               */
00071              public $passedVars=array();
00072 
00073              /**
00074               * array that holds the actual instanciated classes of all constructed helpers for this view
00075               */
00076              protected $helperClasses=array();
00077 
00078              /**
00079               * name of the element that is currently rendered inside the view via $this->renderElement
00080               * @var string
00081               */
00082              protected $elementName='';
00083 
00084              /**
00085               * name of the layout we are rendering to
00086               * @var string
00087               */
00088              protected $layoutName='';
00089 
00090              /**
00091               * used to stop us from accidently contructing helpers twice
00092               * @var bool
00093               */
00094              protected $didConstructHelpers=false;
00095 
00096              /**
00097               * constructor. copies all needed variables from the controller
00098               * @param object controller that uses this view
00099               */
00100              function __construct(&$controller) {
00101                           $this->controller=$controller;
00102                           $this->params=&$controller->params;
00103                           $this->action=&$controller->action;
00104                           $this->webroot=&$controller->webroot;
00105                           $this->helpers=&$controller->helpers;
00106                           $this->base=&$controller->base;
00107                           $this->basePath = &$controller->basePath;
00108              }
00109 
00110              /**
00111               * construct all helpers we found in our helpers property
00112               */
00113              protected function constructHelpers() {
00114                           if ($this->didConstructHelpers) {
00115                             return;
00116                           }
00117                           kataUse('helper');
00118 
00119                           foreach ($this->helpers as $name) {
00120                                        $name=strtolower($name);
00121                                        $classname=ucfirst(strtolower($name)).'Helper';
00122 
00123                                        if (!class_exists($classname)) {
00124                                                     if (!file_exists(ROOT.'views'.DS.'helpers'.DS.$name.'.php')) {
00125                                                                  throw new Exception('Cant find Helper ['.$name.'] used by View ['.$this->action.'] of Controller ['.get_class($this->controller).']');
00126                                                     }
00127                                                     require(ROOT.'views'.DS.'helpers'.DS.$name.'.php');
00128                                        }
00129 
00130                                        $h = classRegistry::getObject($classname);
00131                                        $h->webroot=&$this->webroot;
00132                                        $h->action=&$this->action;
00133                                        $h->params=&$this->controller->params;
00134                                        $h->base=&$this->base;
00135                                        $h->basePath=&$this->basePath;
00136                                        $h->vars=&$this->controller->viewVars;
00137                                        $this->helperClasses[$name]=$h;
00138                           }
00139 
00140                           $this->didConstructHelpers = true;
00141              }
00142 
00143              /**
00144               * render the actual view and layout. normally done at the end of a action of a controller
00145               * <code>
00146               * 1. all helpers are constructed here, very late, so we dont accidently waste cpu cycles
00147               * 2. all variables, helpers and params given from the controller are extracted to global namespace
00148               * 3. the actual view-template is rendered
00149               * 4. the content of the rendered view is rendered into the layout
00150               * </code>
00151               * @param string $action name of the view
00152               * @param string $layout name of the layout
00153               * @return string html of the view
00154               */
00155              public function render($action,$layout) {
00156                           $this->action=$action;
00157 
00158                           $this->constructHelpers();
00159                           foreach ($this->passedVars as $name) {
00160                                        extract(array($name=>$this->$name),EXTR_REFS);
00161                           }
00162                           extract(array('params'=>$this->controller->params));
00163                           extract($this->controller->viewVars);
00164                           extract($this->helperClasses);
00165                           $GLOBALS['__THIS'] = $this;
00166 
00167                           $out='';
00168                           $viewfile = ROOT.'views'.DS.strtolower(substr(get_class($this->controller),0,-10)).DS.$action.".thtml";
00169                           if (!file_exists($viewfile)) {
00170                                        throw new Exception('Cant find view ['.$this->action.'] of controller ['.get_class($this->controller).'], Path is ['.$viewfile.']');
00171                           }else {
00172                                        ob_start();
00173                                        require($viewfile);
00174                                        $out=ob_get_clean();
00175                           }
00176 
00177                           return $this->renderLayout($out,$layout);
00178              }
00179 
00180              /**
00181               * renders the given string into the layout. normally called by renderView()
00182               * <code>
00183               * 1. title and content are extracted into global namespace
00184               * 2. all variables, helpers and params given from the controller are extracted to global namespace
00185               * 3. the given string is rendered into the layout
00186               * 4. the html-output of this routine normally lands in the controllers output property
00187               * </code>
00188               * @param string $contentForLayout raw html to be rendered to the layout (normally the content of a view)
00189               * @param string $layout name of the layout
00190               */
00191              public function renderLayout($contentForLayout,$layout){
00192                           $this->layoutName=$layout;
00193                           if ($this->layoutName!==null) {
00194             $this->constructHelpers();
00195 
00196                                        extract(array('content_for_layout'=>$contentForLayout,'title_for_layout'=>$this->controller->pageTitle,'this'=>$this));
00197                                        extract($this->controller->viewVars);
00198                                        extract($this->helperClasses);
00199                                        $GLOBALS['__THIS'] = $this;
00200 
00201                                        ob_start();
00202                                        if (!file_exists(ROOT.'views'.DS.'layouts'.DS.$this->layoutName.'.thtml')) {
00203                                                     throw new Exception('Cant find layout ['.$this->layoutName.']');
00204                                        } else {
00205                                                     require(ROOT.'views'.DS.'layouts'.DS.$this->layoutName.'.thtml');
00206                                        }
00207                                        return ob_get_clean();
00208                           } else {
00209                                        return $contentForLayout;
00210                           }
00211              }
00212 
00213              /**
00214               * render a element and return the resulting html. an element is kind of like a mini-view you can use inside a view (via $this->renderElement()).
00215               * it has (like a view) access to all variables a normal view has
00216               * @param string $name name of the element (see views/elements/) without .thtml
00217               * @param an array of variables the element can access in global namespace
00218               */
00219              public function renderElement($name,$params=array()) {
00220                           $this->elementName=$name;
00221                           extract($this->controller->viewVars);
00222                           extract($params);
00223                           extract($this->helperClasses);
00224                           $GLOBALS['__THIS'] = $this;
00225 
00226                           if (!file_exists(ROOT.'views'.DS.'elements'.DS.$this->elementName.".thtml")) {
00227                                        throw new Exception('Cant find element ['.$this->elementName.']');
00228                           }else {
00229                                        ob_start();
00230                                        require(ROOT.'views'.DS.'elements'.DS.$this->elementName.".thtml");
00231                                        return ob_get_clean();
00232                           }
00233                           return null;
00234              }
00235 
00236 
00237 }
